com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Class ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
SmartApplication.DefaultExceptionHandler
Enclosing class:
ActivityController
public static class ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActivityController.ExceptionHandler

A simple implementation of ActivityController.ExceptionHandler which pops-up error dialog boxes and toasts.

The labels of the dialogs and the toasts are i18ned though the provided SmartApplication.I18N provided instance.

Method Detail

onBusinessObjectAvailableException

public boolean onBusinessObjectAvailableException(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                  LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception)
Description copied from interface: ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
Is invoked whenever the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() throws an exception.

Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Specified by:
onBusinessObjectAvailableException in interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
Parameters:
activity - the activity that issued the exception ; cannot be null
Returns:
true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

onOtherException

public boolean onOtherException(android.app.Activity activity,
                                java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Description copied from interface: ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
Is invoked whenever an activity implementing LifeCycle throws an unexpected exception, or when an exception is thrown during a AppPublics.GuardedCommand execution.

This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Specified by:
onOtherException in interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
See Also:
for the explanation about the return value and the activity parameter

onContextException

public boolean onContextException(android.content.Context context,
                                  java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Description copied from interface: ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown with a non-activity context.

This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Specified by:
onContextException in interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
Parameters:
context - the context that issued the exception
See Also:
for the explanation about the return value

checkConnectivityProblemInCause

protected final boolean checkConnectivityProblemInCause(android.app.Activity activity,
                                                        java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                                                        boolean proposeRetry)
Attempts to find a connection issue in the provided exception by iterating over the causes, and display a dialog box if any.

Parameters:
activity - in case a connection issue is discovered, it will be used to pop up a dialog box. When the dialog box "OK" button is hit, it will be simply dismissed
throwable - the exception to be inspected
proposeRetry - when set to trueReturns:
true if and only a connection issue has been detected

isAConnectivityProblem

public static boolean isAConnectivityProblem(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Parameters:
throwable - the exception to investigate
Returns:
true if and only if the exception results from a connectivity issue by inspecting its causes tree

searchForCause

public static final java.lang.Throwable searchForCause(java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                                                       java.lang.Class... exceptionClass)
Attempts to find a specific exception in the provided exception by iterating over the causes, starting with the provided exception itself.

Parameters:
throwable - the exception to be inspected
exceptionClass - a list of exception classes to look after
Returns:
null if and only one of the provided exception classes has not been detected ; the matching cause otherwise
